comments.text:
There IS something romantic about a flawed, damaged man who can allow love 
in and start to let go of the darkness within himself. For me this was just 
a story with a nice ending. Love conquers all, and can defeat even the 
darkest of souls. No doubt it begins with a very dark and disturbing 
Christian who would make most women run for the hills, and not because of 
the sex, but it is a story, so she has to engage with him.  I liked that in 
the beginning, Anna is the young, innocent, inexperienced one, and she ends 
up being the teacher in many ways. When Christian begins to doubt himself, 
and see his flaws, he decides that he wants no more part in sex the way he 
knew it, whereas Anna is hooked and teaches him that play is ok, if it is 
for the right reasons. Toward the end I felt Anna was a very empowering 
character, in the book.  In reality I caught myself saying after the first 
few interactions, that in real life, I would probably throw something large 
and heavy at him......right between the eyes. But this is not real life, 
its fiction, and when you read the story, you are reading what the 
fictional character in the story did. I have never seen the movie, nor do I 
think I want to after all I have heard, it did not translate the book well.
comments.author: thorsmom nulte

comments.author: darkfur3

comments.text:
As you have said about GTA, read a synopsis or a summary of all three Fifty 
Shades of Grey books. It doesn't interest you, does it? If you don't know 
what happens during the WHOLE story then you shouldn't be so quick to say 
how it should be interpreted. That is exactly how I feel about games like 
GTA, I don't care for them and I find them pretty stupid personally. But 
that is ME, that doesn't mean I have to go around putting people down for 
liking it or criticizing what I think it portrays. That is what people do 
with 50 shades, without even knowing the story. Why can they just not even 
regard the damn books or the movie if they don't like it? I am not even a 
big fan of the story dude, I am just sick and tired of people ranting about 
it just because they don't like it. That was my whole point, I wasn't 
saying it is a magnificent work of literature, just that people need to 
leave its fandom alone.
comments.author: Laura Gonzalez

comments.text:
+Laura Gonzalez I never said it was educational. I'm saying that there is 
more there than just finding a hooker and blowing her brains out with a 
shotgun. That is the individual player not the game itself. Hell I play the 
games a lot and I still haven't purposely gone on a murder rampage on 
innocent civilians.

 I still see GTA IV as probably 'The Godfather' of video games in terms of 
story. If you aren't going to play it at least read a synopsis or watch a 
cutscene video. It was a very well crafted and beautifully tragic story, 
that if told in a movie format it would undoubtedly be nominated for an 
Oscar. 

I was talking about the first book/movie. I don't know what happens after 
that nor do I care. She gave no clear statement of consent vocally, 
visually or written. As Rob Walker so adequately says "She just takes it"

It doesn't matter that it's a 'romantic' story with a twist. It's poorly 
written, the characters make no decision that even hinges on sane human 
logic and everyone who actually is in the BDSM life style HAAAAAATES this 
book because it goes against everything the subculture of BDSM stands for.

That is my problem with this franchise is that some one who has no business 
or talent being a writer is making bank off of Twilight fanfiction smut 
while other more talented individuals with unique and original ideas get 
pushed aside.
comments.author: darkfur3

comments.text:
+darkfur3 I understand but please don't try to make it seem as if GTA is 
educational lol. All I am saying is that the damn story is just another 
romantic novel with a twist. And by the way, she marries him, and they have 
a kid. I am pretty sure she is well sober when both things happen.  And It 
is quite sad to see kids playing GTA and fiding amusement in running people 
over, being thugs and hooking up with prostitutes through a video game, now 
THAT is scary. That's just my point of view, I respect yours.
comments.author: Laura Gonzalez

comments.text:
The difference is that GTA doesn't really promote it. It gives the player 
the tools and lets them run wild. If anything the GTA IV outright condemns 
the actions. Showing that a life of crime leads to bad circumstances and 
few people leave it alive. Even people who are only connected to the 
characters end up dying. I also recall GTA:San Andreas being extremely 
anti-drug with the whole story centering around cleaning up the hood from 
drug dealers and dirty cops. GTA's story is always meant to be taken with 
tongue in cheek.

50 shades though was meant to be a legitimate romance novel and that is 
where people take issue. Also it actually wasn't a consensual relationship 
and the contract was null and void. He got her drunk when she was looking 
over the contract "making her brave". She never actively said "Yes I want 
this" while sober through out the whole story. Though the real issue I have 
with it is that it was originally a fanfiction and written horribly. It's a 
huge success when the Author has no originality nor talent. This is the 
world we are living in and that just sickens me to no end.
comments.author: darkfur3

comments.text:
+Laura Gonzalez
Thank you
comments.author: cgaskill13

comments.text:
+cgaskill13 It is definitely not a story for everybody and I understand why 
you would not like it. I personally enjoy the "love story" part of it, I 
like how he ends up falling in love with her after he said he did not love 
at all. At the same time, I am not big fan of the overly detailed sex, but 
I guess some people just enjoy reading it perhaps for their own fantasies. 
I don't know. lol
comments.author: Laura Gonzalez

comments.text:
She very willingly does accepts to have sex with him over and over, she 
literally begs him to show her "how bad it can get.." nowhere in the story 
does he act against her will. But my point is simply that people keep 
calling it abuse when it's just another M-rated fanfiction with a different 
twist to it.
comments.author: Laura Gonzalez

comments.text:
None of the sex is really with full consent though. Grey makes the girl 
sign a consent contract, but consent can be given or taken at anytime. I 
would try to explain it further, but I think the best thing to do is for 
you to go search "50 shades of nope" by Jacksfilms and see if you change 
your mind. Tbh idc what your opinion is, but this video really just needs 
to be viewed bc it's great lol (it's funny btw)
comments.author: YouTubeObsessed

comments.text:

comments.text:
+Lucifer ルシファー  Honestly if you do not want to be biased to any side 
(lovers haters) it is about a girl who meets this hot shot millionaire with 
a past. She meets him and they instantly become infatuated with each other 
but because of his traumatic childhood ( his mother was a crack whore with 
an abusive pimp ) he has sadistic tendencies towards women who look like 
her. It is usually with people who are  aware and are part of the lifestyle 
but when he meets her he wants her but she is not part of this S &M world 
so he tries to introduce her into it but she leaves him when she sees any 
sort of violence which is when he realizes his need for her and the story 
goes on from there with a pregnancy twist which causes a rift then brings 
them back together with some other action filled incidents and then they 
live happily ever after in which she has changed and fixed him. This story 
is actually not THAT pornographic if you want to take the standards of 
today and it really preys on women's love for "fixing" broken mysterious 
beautiful  millionaires who just happen to fall in love with the plain 
jane. When in reality they are all fat potbellied bald men with supermodel 
wives half their age. Also it used to be twilight fanfiction titled Master 
of the Universe it was also very famous then just like now it was the most 
reviewed and read fanfic on the site fanfiction.net until she moved it to a 
private blog then proceeded to remove it copy paste it with changed names 
and deny any link to her fanfiction fan base.

- THIS IS SHOW BUSINESS TALK
RIGHT HERE.

OVER THE YEARS,
I'VE SHOWN YOU A LOT OF SCENES

FROM DIFFERENT MOVIES
THAT I'VE BEEN CUT OUT OF.

WHAT HAPPENS IS,
I GET CAST AND I SHOW UP,

AND I WORK, YOU KNOW,
LIKE A PROFESSIONAL.

I LEARN MY LINES, AND I, YOU
KNOW, REALLY PREPARE THE SCENES.

AND FOR SOME STUPID REASON,
THE PART GETS CUT.

SO, THE "50 SHADES OF GREY"
MOVIE IS COMING OUT NEXT YEAR.

AND I AM SO HAPPY
AND PROUD TO SAY,

I GOT THE LEAD ROLE
AND I AM DEFINITELY GONNA BE

THEY'RE ACTING LIKE
IT'S DAKOTA JOHNSON.

BECAUSE NO ONE KNOWS THEIR WAY
AROUND A WHIP MORE THAN ME.

SO THEY JUST
RELEASED THE TRAILER.
I'M SO PROUD TO SHARE IT.

THIS IS THE FIRST TIME
ANYONE'S SEEN IT, AND I'M...

I MEAN, I'M STARRING IN
"50 SHADES OF GREY."

SOME OF MY BEST WORK.
PLEASE ENJOY.
- MR. GREY WILL SEE YOU NOW.

- I HAVE A NATURAL INSTINCT
FOR WHAT MAKES A PERSON TIC.
I'D LIKE TO SEE YOUR FACE.
- I'D LIKE YOU TO SEE MY FACE.

- GIVES ME SOME CLUE
WHAT YOU MIGHT BE THINKING.

WELL, I WAS JUST THINKING ABOUT
HOW FUN IT IS

AND HOW EACH ONE OF THEM IS
INDIVIDUALLY WRAPPED IN FOIL

AND HOW BEAUTIFUL THEY ARE,
LIKE LITTLE PRESENTS.
